channel.title: [?] Removing drop down links on adress bar? [?]
channel.description:
How do you delete drop down links in adress bar and google so if someone typed in. "www.ru" in adress bar it wouldn't come up with "www.runescape.com" in drop down. Same with google.
Need help xD also don't post, right click and delete, it doesn't work!

item.title: [?] Removing drop down links on adress bar? [?]

item.description:

Good luck ridding your computer of porn.

item.source: [?] Removing drop down links on adress bar? [?]

item.title: [?] Removing drop down links on adress bar? [?]
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“L O L H A X, post:1, topic:32764”]How do you delete drop down links in adress bar and google so if someone typed in.
“www.ru” in adress bar it wouldn’t come up with “www.runescape.com” in drop down.
Same with google.

Need help xD also don’t post, right click and delete, it doesn’t work![/quote]

It is possible because the information is stored in the registry for Internet Explorer. I’m not sure about Firefox though. So just go to Start > Run > regedit > Press Ctrl + F > type in the URL you want to remove. It has to be exact and then click on Find. Wait for it to finish, and when it finds it, delete the registry entry.

I remember this from IE6, so I’m not sure about IE7. If I were you, I would just set your browser to never keep history of websites you go to by changing "Keep Webpages History: " (or something) to 0.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: [?] Removing drop down links on adress bar? [?]
